title: Eliminating X
text: First, we can multiply equation $$1$$ by $$-2$$ and add it to equation $$2$$, but this gives us $$0=0$$ which is always true. S

title: Finding the General Solution
text: This means that we must find the general solution, or the solution in terms of $$x$$. Add equations $$1$$ and $$2$$ to get $$3x-2z=0$$. $$z=\frac{3}{2} x$$. Back-substitute the expressionn for $$z$$ and solve for $$y$$. $$2x+y-\frac{9}{2} x=0, y=\frac{5}{2} x$$. So, the solution is (x,5/2x,3/2x)
